thread.title: VIDEO: Savannah Coast Guardsmen rescue mom, baby stranded in South Carolina flood waters
thread.title_full: VIDEO: Savannah Coast Guardsmen rescue mom, baby stranded in South Carolina flood waters | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: VIDEO: Savannah Coast Guardsmen rescue mom, baby stranded in South Carolina flood waters
text:
Photos Back | Next Cristi Mueller, second from left, holds her infant daughter, Kailynn Walts, next to the Coast Guard Air Station Savannah crew who came to their rescue Sunday in Huger, S.C. Mueller and her daughter were hoisted from an area that was inundated with significant flooding. (U.S. Coast Guard photo by Petty Officer 2nd Class Anthony L. Soto) Back | Next The U.S. Coast Guard says one of its Savannah-based helicopter crews rescued a Lowcountry mother and her infant from the roof of their flooded home near Charleston on Sunday. (screen capture from U.S. Coast Guard video) By Savannah Morning News The U.S. Coast Guard says one of its Savannah-based helicopter crews rescued a Lowcountry mother and her infant from the roof of their flooded home near Charleston on Sunday.
Cristi Mueller and Kailynn Walts, her 15-month-old daughter, became stranded due to heavy rain and flooding in Huber, S.C. Both mother and child are in good condition with no injuries, said Petty Officer 2nd Class Anthony Soto.
The Coast Guard was notified of the distress by the family at 6:24 a.m. They reported being stranded in their home due to severe flooding in their neighborhood.
A crew aboard an MH-65 Dolphin helicopter from Coast Guard Air Station Savannah was launched to rescue the two. Mueller and her daughter were hoisted and taken to a local airport.
"Me and my husband are very proud of our Coast Guard," Mueller said in a news release. "They went above and beyond and made something scary a lot less traumatic."
